title: Mac users having issues with patch 7.1?
body:
So...
Today I got on league and was playing a ranked match and first thing that happened was my screen never got to the loading page after champ select so i turned my laptop off (it's a mac), and restarted it, after reconnecting I was able to get into the game and see my screen, then things got weird.

First off, my screen was laggy, but I had consistent 40 ping like a always do, my FPS was constantly around 100 despite my screen constantly pausing.  

Second this pausing intensified at weird times, for instance when I recall my screen would pause until I finished if i clicked around the map and wanted to see what was going on in a lane or something my screen would pause, and my ping never increased and my FPS never dropped.

Third,  I tried playing and ARAM game recently to see if maybe this was just an issue with this one game, this time the screen completely loaded, although the load screen never came up it was just black.  When the game loaded the screen was still black but i could hear the sound.  I flashed and heard the flash, I tried using an ability and heard it go off.  I also think I could type in the chat, but the screen remained black.

I've noticed other mac users running into problems similar to these ever since this new patch, and some other problems, but was just wondering if anyone on this board was experiencing these problems and new how to fix it, or if this is something on riots end.  This wasn't happening before the patch and I could play everything fine, so i don't know whats going on.

Basically from what I can see is that when my screen goes from the champ select to the loading screen (Then into the game), the screen resolution of your mac automatically changes to 'default' I believe. However, the majority of the mac users playing league has the setting on 'More Space'. When this happens, from what I think, the resolution between your mac and the game client is different so like you said, if I was to get into the game, everything works fine, but I have to alt tab then come back into the game, my screen would be frozen if I don't click my mouse for like 0.2 seconds.

So for me when I play, the 'temporary' fix that I have (Because I have to do it everytime I alt-tab) is this.

1. Just get into the game then when you look at the game/video setting.

2. I have my game resolution set to 1680 x 1050 and the 'More Space' for the Mac display resolution is also 1680 x 1050.  So when my client goes into the game and changes the mac book display resolution to default (1280 x 800), the different resolutions may have caused the problem. So set the game client resolution to 1680 x 1050.

3. Then when your game gets dodgy, try going into system preference for MAC, then Display, and change the resolution to 'More Space' (Because it should've been automatically changed to 'Default'). Once you've changed to 'More Space', just alt-tab back into the game and you should have no problem (Make sure the client resolution is also 1680 x 1050.)

This worked for me but tbh, it is still very annoying having to click on the display settings and changing after every alt tab when needed.
